intro: Paphiopedilum urbanianum f. alboviride, commonly known as the white-green lady's slipper orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers with a white and green coloration. The plant features a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that support its foliage and flowers. Its leaves are typically broad and elliptical, and it produces a single, intricate flower per inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
